markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 15"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Ancestral Echoing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=526)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Age of Ashes</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Dwarf" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=54" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Saggorak" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=269" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City](/Sources.aspx?ID=13) pg. 75</row>

**Price** 9,500 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The wisdom of this weapon’s past owners flows into your mind, amplifying your own abilities with the weapon. Your proficiency rank with this weapon is one step higher than normal, to a maximum of the highest proficiency rank you have in any weapon. For instance, if you had master proficieny with martial weapons and expert proficiency with advanced weapons, you would have master proficiency with advanced weapon that had this rune.

 In addition, while wielding the _ancestral echoing_ weapon, you have expert proficiency in one [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skill relevant to one or more of the weapon’s previous owners. This is typically Dwarven Lore but is ultimately determined by the GM depending on the weapon’s history.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Ancestral Echoing
